intro: Stephanomeria exigua var. coronaria, commonly known as the crownstephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, hemispherical heads, and it has linear, gray-green leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
